heading: Welcome
text: Welcome Cockburn Sound Integrated Ecosystem Model (\(\mathbf{CSIEM}\)) information pages!

heading: Project background
text: report documents CSIEM technical specification, including data integration knowledge generation activities within WAMSI Westport Research program. Improvements model functional capability, detailed validation tests, assessment management climate scenarios reported .

heading: 4.3.1 Model catalogue
text: model files stored models folder. model developed time, model files classified project names model generation identifiers. ‘WC’ folder contains model files used assessing PSDP Water Corporation; ‘Westport’ folder contains model files developed assessing Westport Phase 1 scenarios, ‘WWSMP’ folder contains core CSIEM files updated throughout WAMSI Westport integration project.Models within project directory separated via generation model type. Within WWSMP model folder currently 4 distinct models:wwmsp_swan_v1wwmsp_tfvaed_Gen1.0_1PFTwwmsp_tfvaed_Gen1.5_4PFT_MAGwwmsp-rapidThe wwmsp_swan_v1 first generation Cockburn SWAN Wave model developed (see Section 3.2). Found inside wwmsp_swan_v1 directory two zipped model folders:Coorong_swn_20170101_20220101_UA_Wind_200g_2000w.zipCoorong_swn_20191101_20220101_UA_Wind_200g_2000w.zipThe wwmsp-rapid simulation folder wwmsp_tfvaed_Gen1.0_1PFT simulation folder contain TUFLOW-FV - AED simulations, kept separate constitute different generations, using different grids, simulation periods BC files. Generation 1.5 simulation (wwmsp_tfvaed_Gen1.5_4PFT_MAG) represents upgrade number phytoplankton groups, new material zones addition seagrass.model folder may contain multiple simulation sets, rely model base configuration, minor differences adujstments. Major changes model’s configuration constitute change generation numeber stored separate folder. Note, models uploaded CDM repository may created different agencies researchers maintain consistent naming convention.

heading: 4.3.2 TUFLOW-FV model organisation
text: TUFLOW-FV model found WWMSP project folder created prior structure implemented contains following folder structure:BCs: boundary condition files, including tide inflow boundary files; meteorological boundary files, initial condition files;External: AED model files linked TUFLOW-FV, optionally ‘GOTM’ vertical mixing model CDM 3D mode;Geo: TUFLOW-FV model structure files, including geometry mesh files, GIS files controlling nodestrings material zones;Input: model control/configuration files;Plotting : Directory store model output images;wwmsp_tfvaed_Gen1.5_4PFT_MAG simulation folder also contains bin directory containing windows binaries TFV-AED modelTFV: Build version: 2020.03.105AED: Build version: 2.0.5b

heading: 4.3.3 SWAN Wave Model organisation
text: SWAN wave models found model directory following format:01_geometry : Contains bathymetry input files well automatically generated image bathymetry matlab .mat file containing bathymetry information;02_bc_dbase : Contains processed wind input files03_simulation : Contains INPUT control file required run simulation04_results : Model output directoryThe script required create configure new SWAN wave model can found scripts/datatools/wave directory.

heading: 4.3.4 Model processing toolbox
text:
processing model output predominately written run Matlab. Scripts specifically developed project contained within scripts/modeltools directory. Scripts created Figures 3.9, 3.11 5.2 (among others) can found .Plotting model processing types include:Time-series plotting;Transect plotting;Model animation creation;Error assessment;Wave model plotting;Habitat mapping (e.g., Ruppia & Fish HSI processing mapping)Scenario comparison “DelMap” plotting;Nutrient budget assessments.particular, publicly available GitHub repository called csiem-marvl used contains wide variety matlab scripts functions frequently used process visualise model output. plottfv_polygon plottfv_transect main functions frequently used. Tables 7.3 7.6 Appendix B examples output generated via plottfv_polygon function found aed_matlab_modeltools repository. plotting function uses data gis files stored CDM repository, addition model output create timeseries plots model (averaged within polygon region) compared field data. plotting function also automatically calculate range error statistics based model output field measured data.
Figure 4.6: Example output plottfv_polygon error matrix
plottfv_transect can also found aed_matlab_modeltools repository. plots model data extracted along transect line specified plotting period, compares range field data found within period.

heading: 5.3.2 Performance assessment metrics
text: modelling results compared historical data collected within Cockburn Sound (available), using traditional statistical metrics model error, metrics relevant model performance. approach applied model generation aim identify areas model accurate, areas improvement ongoing calibration effort.Error metrics : Initially, model performance predicting range relevant variables including salinity, temperature, nitrogen, phosphorus total chlorophyll-assessed set statistical metrics, calculations statistical metrics performed observation site number field observations >10 assessment period.core statistical metrics considered consist :\(r\): regression coefficient, Varies -1 1, score 1 indicating model varies perfectly observations negative score indicating model varies inversely observations. consistent bias may present even high score r obtained.\(BIAS\): bias average prediction average observation assessing period. method presents magnitude discrepancy model results observational data.\(MAE\): mean absolute error: Similar RMSE except absolute value used. reduces bias towards large events. Values near zero indicate good model skill.\(RMS\): root mean squared error, Measures mean magnitude, direction, difference model data observations, hence can used measure bias. Values near zero desirable. method affected cancellation negative positive errors, squaring data may cause bias towards large events.\(nash\): Nash-Sutcliffe metric (also called \(NSE\) \(MEF\) matrix modelling efficiency, measures mean magnitude difference model data observations. method compares performance model uses mean observed data. value 1 indicate perfect model, value zero indicates performance similar simply using mean observed data.Seasonality : model results assessed terms degree seasonal fluctuation, seen field data. Whilst captured error metrics (e.g. R, visual assessment can assess timing issues related seasonal peaks.Transects : model results assessed terms seasonal mean along length domain (longitudinal transect). transect analysis allows system wide scale assessment conditions, smooths noise local variability field model predictions.Advanced measures : model results finally assessed considered partitioning nutrients terms inorganic vs organic, expected measures.Confidence : Based assessment evaluate confidence model assigning variable following categories:GoodAcceptable, andCaution.confidence evaluation, considers:Quality observed data, influenced field laboratory data limitations, methodologies, processes protocols.Error metric scores relative typically reported literature water quality models (e.g., Arhonditsis Brett, 2004).Ability CSIEM capture mean indicator spatial gradient seasonality.Partitioning water quality constituents within different ecosystem pools.Natural variability indicator different temporal scales (.e. sub-daily seasonal).
